title: The Family (Oikogeneia)
reading_greek:
MEMBERS
- Ο Πατέρας (Father) / Ο Μπαμπάς (Dad)
- Η Μητέρα (Mother) / Η Μαμά (Mom)
- Οι Γονείς (Parents - Plural)
- Ο Αδερφός (Brother)
- Η Αδερφή (Sister)
- Ο Παππούς (Grandfather)
- Η Γιαγιά (Grandmother)
- Ο Θείος / Η Θεία (Uncle / Aunt)
- Ο Ξάδερφος (Cousin)

POSSESSIVES
- Ο πατέρας μου (My father)
- Η αδερφή σου (Your sister)
reading_english:
VOCABULARY: FAMILY

1. FORMAL vs INFORMAL:
   - Patera / Mitera (Formal).
   - Mpampa / Mama (Informal).

2. SIBLINGS:
   - Aderfos / Aderfi.
   - Plural: Aderfia (Siblings/Brothers).

3. GRANDPARENTS:
   - Pappous is irregular (-ous ending).
   - Giagia.

4. POSSESSIVES RULE: Put 'mou' (my) or 'sou' (your) AFTER the noun.
   - O pateras mou (The father of-me).
audio_script:
Family - Oikogeneia. 

Meet the family.
- Pateras and Mitera are the formal terms. You will usually hear 'Mpampas' and 'Mama'.

Your siblings are 'Aderfia'. 
- 'Exeis aderfia?' (Do you have siblings?).

Don't forget Grandpa 'Pappous' and Grandma 'Giagia'. 

And the most important grammar here: Possessives go AFTER.
'My mother' is 'H mitera mou'. 
Literally 'The mother of-me'. 
Never say 'Mou mitera'. Always 'H mitera mou'.
